channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.description: Trump’s tariffs stunned Main Street. Now they may starve Wall Street.

item.description: Consumer confidence is buckling, and debt is mounting. Here’s how to steer your portfolio.

item.title: Why enterprise RAG systems fail: Google study introduces ‘sufficient context’ solution
item.description: Google's "sufficient context" helps refine RAG systems, reduce LLM hallucinations, and boost AI reliability for business applications.

item.title: OpenAI updates Operator to o3, making its $200 monthly ChatGPT Pro subscription more enticing
item.description: Operator remains a research preview and is accessible only to ChatGPT Pro users. The Responses API version will continue to use GPT-4o.

item.title: After GPT-4o backlash, researchers benchmark models on moral endorsement—find sycophancy persists across the board
item.description: A new benchmark can test how much LLMs become sycophants, and found that GPT-4o was the most sycophantic of the models tested.

item.title: Trump threatens Apple with 25% tariff: Is now a good time to buy an iPhone?
item.description: On Friday, President Donald Trump threatened Apple with 25% tariffs on any iPhone sold, but not made, in the U.S.

item.title: My daughter’s boyfriend, a guest in my home, offered to powerwash part of my house — then demanded money
item.description: “The amount was about what I would have paid to get the whole house done, and not just one side.’
